39377800.review:
Evil Genius is now over 13 years old and yet it still retains a huge amount of playability and indeed replayability. I would happily recommend anyone give it a try as long as they arent looking for a quick fix, short attention span game.

If you ever dreamed of being a typical 80's arch villain, if you loved the cheesiness of bond or the Austin Powers films that lampooned the genre then you will likely adore the game.

The game has cheese, strategy, base building, comedy and fun in bundles. The only downside is the absolute grind that generating cash requires. If that bothers you then the simple workaround is to cheat and spawn extra cash so you can focus on the fun that is trap designs and progression. 

Rebellion could do far worse than reinvent this game with Kingsman style themes and retain the same gameplay and progressions but much higher gfx resolutions etc.

The big worry is they start to mess around with the gameplay or 'modernise; things in a Ubisoft kind of way and completely screw it up with some form of badly thought through multiplayer system.

39285365.review: This game, though older, is insanely fun. It can be addicting at times with hillarious ways to defeat the super agents. I recommend this game to just about anyone, especially fans of Strategy games!

39231720.review: Самая лучшая игра что я играл, и одна из немногих которую я со скрежетом зубов прошел до конца!

39220940.review: Evil Genius is a gem lost in time. It is insanly beutiful for its time (2004) I tested responses for the date of creation most people thoght it was made in 2014 based on the graphics alone. It also is very intence,the nail bitting tention when you doing a mission if is stealing uberloot or kidnapping a spinmaster. I have played 10hrs this week and 35hrs complete I have never for a second not wanted to play this game.

39016390.review:
This is one of my favorite games and I was happy to see it come to steam. I still have the cd-rom package from '04, but the disc got destroyed :(

You get to pick an Austin Powers -esque persona and play as an evil genius and try to fulfill your doomsday mission. All of the character sprites or minions/henchmen are interesting to watch, with a unique art style, and there are plenty of fun interactions with base objects to look for. The gameplay consists of building a mountain dungeon, sending your henchmen to the board-game style overworld, and having they steal plans/art/machines to further your ambitions. Some of the art you steal is returned to your base for your henchmen to admire (for a loyalty bonus), and the nations of the world send their agents to retrieve them. Your notoriety increases as you steal more, and the agents become more gooder and tougher and more frequent. Eventually you steal all of the items necessary to complete your doomsday object, and you win!

There are some hurdles along the way:
-You need to dispose of dead bodies.
-Tourists come to the island to... tour. And then they freak out when they see dead bodies or guns.
-You need to train your workers into different careers paths: soldiers, scientists, or social people. Scientists research new items for your base (traps or security features or rec room items), social minions are better suited for non lethal diversion of enemies. Soldiers more effetively arm themselves.
-Super-agents are sent to kill your evil genius, and they each have a unique scenario to defeat them. They will judo-chop your minions all day long if you try to get rid of them like other enemies.

I am very excited for the sequel announced this year. Sierra games was a good publisher.


Likes:
-Base building. There is a ton of freedom to build however you like. Of course, the game doesn't really provide you with much help either. The starting build area is small, but your options improve in the future. I like using the console to enable debug mode to allow more creative building. Do this at your own risk, you can bork your save.

-Traps. They're buggy, but it's fun to set up a room to release bees on unsuspecting investigators. You have to tie a trap with a sensor, and the sensors occupy space, which can limit some designs. Sadly, some agents are too smart and they either won't fall for tripping the trap sensor, or they start attacking and causing the traps to explode. Whomp-whomp.

-Soundtrack. Omg. Just run the OST on Youtube when you're bored at work.

-Modding. The games files are a library of notepad-editable xmls. You can tweak the properties of anything or even define new base items to build. You can go further and add textures to create your own characters. 


Unlikes:
-Controls. Your base consists of you (the evil genius, 1 life), your elite henchmen (limited #, 3 lives), and your minions (unlimited # to hire, 1 life). The minions are assigned to tasks in the background and you cannot re-order a minion to a building task (I.e. if they're right next to a box that need to be moved). Your henchmen can be told to move anywhere and kill anyone and they will, but they don't build. And your evil genius can be told to move anywhere; but, he can't attack, can't build, and his only plus if he produces a passive AoE bonus to your minions (loyalty +, perception +).
 
-Tutorials. Yeah, they suck. The interface for the help videos is also trashy. There's not much in the game that's difficult conceptually, but there are some issues with building that may not be intuitive. I.e. you cannot destroy a room that is the only access path to a deeper room.

-Money. The method for generating cash is by sending henchmen to the world map, in an overworld boardgame-styled menu. Here, any henchmen set to "steal" will produce X amount of dollars per minute. The game with place enemy agents in the region, and there are behind-the-scene dice rolls to kill your henchmen. I don't have much for suggestions in replacing this; but I've always found the # of henchmen required to be on the overworld stealing money at the rate I want to spend it was absurd. There are cheat codes to add $.

-Population cap. I'm not a fan of these, and they're easily editable with the .ini config file, but your pop cap is 100 henchmen. I usually set this to 500. If you need to send 40 of them to the overworld to generate money, it limits your base functionality. There is a slider in your base menu that controls the rate at which you hire new lv 1 henchmen, which can be changed from 1 / min to 1 / sec (w/ a hefty cash penalty).

Resource income can be a little slow at time and costly in manpower, but after a slowish start the game really opens up into an amazing build your own evil lair.

With multiple endings depending on your choice of doomsday device, as well as how you deal with the Super agents that come to stop you, this game is a lovely escape to the dark side

38606548.review:
Evil Genius is fantastic. Well deserved reputation as a cult classic. I had nostalgia for Dungeon Keeper 2, but Evil Genius uses the formula and surpasses it quite a bit. For one thing EG is more recent, so it runs well on newer systems. There is a patch and a fix to make it widescreen you should use. But the funny thing is, normally letterbox makes me bounce off a game, but EG is so engrossing I didn't even notice for hours! 

It has a cute, cartoony art style that has helped the graphics age gracefully. The spy theme is novel for this type of game. There is a lot of quirky personality and attention to detail. The orchestral score is great. It has a lengthy campaign. If you don't want to grind then just use an infinite money cheat. Still a blast and a nice challenge. 

I'm glad base builders are gaining more notoriety, pardon the pun. And EG is one of the best ever. I'm happy they're making a proper sequel and I'll be right in line to play it!

Some things to keep in mind though: This game is glitchy, this game can be frustrating and this game can be slow. If you like fast-paced busy gameplay I wouldn't recommend. 37846830.review:
I've restarted this game several times - you pick one of three Evil Genuis persona (who's perks might be broken if they were never patched) and build a base where you train your minions - they defend your base and run missions on the world map - as you gain infamy your base is attacked by stronger soldiers and eventually Secret Agents (007-like characters) to try and assassinate you.

however, building your base on an island also means that nosey tourists might come along and you also need to keep them out of your base and away from your traps - lest you attract unwanted attention.

inside your base you need to build hallways and training centers and freezers for storing the corpese of all the soldiers your minions kill. - you can rig up traps that can combo with other traps (a wall spring that pushes someone back into a fire pit) which can be entertaining unto itself trying to get combos to work

Evil Genius is one of those games that you sit down at and play for hours at a time and lose track of the clock - but it's not something so obsessive that it's the only game you'll ever play.

Best game ever? no.
Am I glad I played it? sure :P

40843237.review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]推薦程度[/th]
        [th]★★★★★[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th]語言[/th]
        [th]民間簡體漢化[/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[h1][i]真正繼承「地城守護者」精神的作品，來進行一場不血腥、很搞笑的邪惡計畫吧！[/i][/h1] 

少數讓玩家徹底扮演壞人的遊戲，你可以想像他是「地城守護者」+「模擬市民」兩種玩法的結合；還記得電影「王牌大賤諜(Austin Powers)」嗎？ 在遊戲中，你將有機會扮演如同「Dr. Evil」的邪惡角色，建設你的邪惡基地，並招募專業的人才、雇傭兵、科學家、政客、花花公子...等手下，進行一連串的邪惡計畫，來征服世界！


[h1]扮演專業的壞蛋：[/h1]

在遊戲裡，你需要在觀光島嶼上面，安置你的邪惡基地，招募手下建設與擴增，並且安排手下前往世界五大國中，進行滲透、圈錢、搞破壞與竊盜寶物，藉此來獲得資金、聲望，進行邪惡計畫，並吸引更多稀奇古怪的菁英手下加入你的行列。

然而各國也不是省油的燈，你做的每一件壞事都會增加該國的敵意，當敵意達到一定程度，他們便會派遣特工登上你的小島調查，其中包含特務（收集違法事證）、神偷（偷回你盜走的寶物）、爆破員（摧毀你的基地設施），如果當敵意達到最高，他們便會派出士兵（射殺你的人員），以及超級特工登場，包含亞洲區的「李大龍」、北美區的「蘭波」、南美區的「拉丁蛇女」...等

而島上時不時會有觀光客出現，如果這些死老百姓不小心跑進你的基地中，看到你的邪惡計畫，就會被嚇到崩潰亂跑，如果讓他們跑回去自己的國家，會增加該國對你的敵意。所以你會需要建設一座偽度假中心，讓這些觀光客有地方去，不要亂跑。

因此遊戲會一直在諜對諜的情況，你要一邊做壞事、一邊掩蓋事證，而特務則會想盡辦法找出你的不法證據。

[b]培育專業的手下，來應付各種狀況！[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1330537295

[h1]搞笑的作惡多端：[/h1]

當各國對你的敵意升的太高，你就得想辦法對付那些登島的特工了，尤其是士兵特工與超級特工，來者不善。 這時你可以善用菁英手下，以及各種搞笑的手段或陷阱，來對付這些特工；你可以派侍從、政客等手下去賄賂特工，用菁英手下的特殊能力控制特工，或是乾脆安排一堆陷阱干擾他們，像是模擬假人、假鈔機、機器食人花、食人魚地板陷阱...等。

當然，最省事的方法，就是把這些特工通通抓起來拷問！ 拷問的方是千奇百怪，而且往往讓你想不到，遊戲中很多「設施」都可以被拿來當作拷問工具，比如說廚房的攪拌機、圖書間的大型書櫃、實驗室的實驗器材...等，拷問的方是不血腥、不殘忍，反而很好笑，像是把對方綁起來，拿香菸在他面前晃，又或是把對方綁在圓形設備上，讓他體驗「旋轉木馬」。

有的拷問會讓人喪失記憶，忘記他找到的事證，你便可把他丟出基地，而有的拷問會導致對方死亡；遊戲中角色死亡時，會立正倒地，直接變成一件屍袋，甚至不會流一滴血，保證不會弄髒你的地板（笑）。

[b]當然全部殺掉也是一個選擇，但記得蓋一座大一點的冷藏櫃！[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1331378170

[h1]出色的模擬經營：[/h1]

跟地城守護者類型遊戲一樣，我們可以挖出任意大小的房間，決定房間的種類，不同的是，邪惡天才跟模擬市民一樣，我們需要在房間內擺放家具、設施，遊戲中的手下才能使用、進行工作，而擺設的方向、位置，只要保留使用空間，可以依照喜好擺放。

手下也像是模擬市民的人物，有生命值、耐力、腦力、心情、忠誠度...等數值，你除了建設工作空間外，還要安排廚房、休閒中心、圖書館...等房間，給予治療機、健身器材、媒體放映中心...等設施，來讓手下保持忠誠與工作效率。

而遊戲在建設的UI設計與操作都相當親切，你可預先規劃房間，只要不點執行，就不會扣錢，所有指令都可以透過懸掛在物品、角色頭上的令牌來進行，建設、搬移、拆除、擊殺、逮捕、賄賂...等，簡單明瞭。 此外房間都可以安裝監視器，當你下達指令時，監視器偵測到，就會讓對應監視器編號的喇叭，通知附近的手下，前往地點進行工作。

[h1]優點：[/h1]
[olist]
    [*] 體驗當壞人的樂趣，用各種陷阱、設施，欺負「正義人士」。
    [*] 各種搞笑的人物設定與任務設計。
    [*] 好玩的模擬經營。
    [*] 遊戲性高、耐玩。
[/olist]

[b]拷問的時候，還能讓你的首腦（Evil Genius）前往嘲笑對方[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1331378253

[h1]缺點：[/h1]
[olist]
    [*] 總共只有兩個島嶼可以使用，且大小、形狀是固定的。
    [*] 研究科技的前置動作不能主動進行，有時要等很久。
[/olist]

島嶼不是隨機生成的有一點可惜，少了一些變化性；研究科技的前置作業是讓技術人員掃描過物品，但這個掃描行為不能主動進行，所以當想蓋新物品時，技術人員卻一直不去掃描，會讓你氣的想把技術人員抓起來拷問一番！......或許可以真的這樣做，誰叫我們是扮演壞蛋！


[h1]購買建議：推薦給喜歡模擬經營、扮演壞人、地城守護者的玩家。[/h1]

我在學生時代就玩過這款遊戲，那時候是直接嗑英文... 這次有中文漢化後，能看懂搞笑的任務簡介，玩起來體驗也比較不同。 有些人可能會覺得人口上限，只有100有點少，這可以透過MOD調整，但我覺得限制100人口，剛好讓遊戲有一點挑戰。

漢化有時會導致STEAM啟動誤判，變成沒在遊戲狀態，我後來才發現這個問題，遊戲時數大概少計算了10小時左右；不在意遊戲時數的人，就沒怎麼影響，我預估大概20個小時，可以破關一次遊戲。

[h1]個人認為這是目前所有延續地城守護者精神作品中，最棒的一款（沒有之一）。[/h1]

[b]如果你需要遊戲的中文漢化，可以參考我的攻略指南：[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1332187221

[quote] 喜歡我的評論嗎？歡迎參觀我的[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31470152/] 遊戲私房菜[/url] [/quote]

40831443.review:
Evil Genius is a timeless classic that was WAAAAY ahead of its time - from snazzy, theme-appropriate graphics to style to soundtrack, this game is a masterpiece that should be enjoyed & known by many, yet the gameplay flaws, cumbersome UI, lots of bugs and quirky AI of your minions (coupled with VERY high difficulty and frustrating jugling between your base and world domination screen) lower the appeal of what would've been (with a fair bit of polish) a game with a reputation higher than the fabled Dungeon Keeper!

Still, I would wholeheartedly recommend Evil Genius to all you aspiring evildoers, because this is currently THE ONLY game that puts you properly into the shoes of a megalomaniac from JB movies, with lots of humour be it written or perceived (the animations are really well done and funny!), PHENOMENAL soundtrack, and full to the brim with 60's spy movies style. Also, Evil Genius 2 is currently in production (hooray!), so better get your feet wet now in anticipation of the sequel to one of the best games of all time (in my personal opinion, mind you :))

40774569.review:
Einfach nur riesen Spielspaß für wenig Geld!

Würde mich über einen Nachfolger freuen.

40748145.review:
Loved this game! need more! has anyone else noticed the similarities between this game and despicable me? they could make a second version of this game just by using those characters. 

-my favorite part was designing the layout for my evil base, and I found the uber trap definately helps with cash flow. highly recommend you go on youtube to find out how to make the uber trap! 
-love that you can interrogate prisoners with different things in your base
-took me 26 hours to beat the game and I really stretched that out because I enjoyed completing every little mission. (I got the game on sale for $2 but I'd still happily pay for it.. even at full price the cost to game would be .42c an hour haha.)

-the things I didn't like is that you cannot demolish hallways (or I haven't found a way) so plan your base accordingly. 
-if you make a room that has a wide opening you can't demolish that either (or I haven't found a way)
-DO NOT CHOOSE RED IVAN! he really messed up the agents I wanted him to terminate.. but in the process he just wrecks my base... I can't even begin to tell you how many doors I had to rebuy. In the end I just kept him stealing on the world map.

Now.. I'm off to replay the game as a different evil genius muhahahahahaha

6/10 Fun concept, but not sure it aged all that well. Would like to see a sequel.

40538232.review: Really good game, still play it to this day, and excited for the sequal

40498458.review:
This is a great cooldown game for between your other games. Be warned though. sometimes with all the managment of all those minions, you may lose track of time.
 
You choose between 3 evil genius' each with there own hidden bonuses. You then build a base, steal things, protect your base from other spies  and snoops, and prepare for world conquest.

40471267.review:
[h1] Let’s review : Evil Genius   [/h1]

First of all, i have to say this is one of my favorite games of all time, i played countless hours when i bought this game in physical CD. Here you take the mantle of a Evil “james bond type” Genius. And you must built your lair, with traps against special agents, and influence world events by placing spies and much much more!

[h1] Pros: [/h1]

+ You must build your own lair on an Island! Complete with lasers and dumb minions!
+ Survive the constant attacks from the world greatest super agents! And capture them!
+ Plan your lair carefully, provide sufficient energy, give things for your minions to do, train those same dumb minions and make real henchmen out of them. 
+ Manage everything from energy to motivation! But above all else, keep your Evil Genius alive!
+ Nostalgia (at least for me)
+ Conquer the world, and gather new unit types. And thru Acts of Infamy raise your notoriety in the world, but beware, you’ll attract attentions from the all the “good guy” agencies!
+ Extremely funny animations and pure comedy effects. 

  [h1] Cons: [/h1]

- Absolutely none, despite being an oldie game, be aware that the graphics are up to date!

[h1] Final Review [/h1]

I had to have this game in my library and its one title I display with pride. One of my favorite games in the strategy/management genre. I took the mantle of an Evil Genius and I wore it well for many hours, as I captured agents and forced them to tell me what they were hiding. And created a neat lair riddled with incredible traps that would make 007 run in the opposite direction. I have to give this game a perfect 10 in my book, and I wish there would be an Evil Genius 2. It would be glorious!

Enjoy Guys and Girls, and if this review helped you in any way please leave me a Thumbs up, i would appreciate it immensely. And please consider joining me on Curate This – A Honest Review at:

http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31479106/

40420648.review:
10 из 10. Когда то играл пиратку, давно. Дико понравилась. Недавно наткнулся на это снова и ещё в стиме. Купил не думая.
Докатился до того что играю с чит кодами ибо СЛОЖНА, но даже они не портят мне геймплей, что редко для подобных игр. Как жаль что я не знал о кодах в своё время.
Хочу добавить что даже коды не упрощают мне жизнь.

40373461.review:
Со времени выпуска этой игры подросло практически новое поколение, ибо сам играл в нее когда было 14 лет. Отличная игра которая хорошо затягивает, этакая смесь симулятора бога, градостроительного симулятора и Симсов. 
плюсы:
+Графика. Приятная графика, которая благодаря остроумную подходу к созданию моделей и текстур, в стиле фильмов Бондианы, Остина Пауерса итд..., не выглядит устаревшей и смотрится достойно даже спустя 14 лет. 
+ Звук. Очень качественное звуковое сопровождение с позиционированием и конечно же музыка. Проработано все до мелочей: каждый шаг, каждый крик, или шум прибора. детализация звука непревзойденная, особенно если учесть что это РТС.
+ Юмор: в игре полно всяких пародийных моментов: начиная от пыток танцами в стиле Майкла Джексона и заканчивая супергероями в виде клишированных героев боевиков из 80-90: Рембо, Джеки Чан, Бонд... 
+ разнообразие всевозможных построек, исследований, и конечно же систем ловушек, установка и использование которых заслуживает отдельного гайда.
+Цена. На распродаже 1,5$ смех за такую качественную игру, однозначно маст хев.
Минусов практически нет, мелочи:
- лично у меня при запуске игры не считало "игровое время", потому приходится запускать сразу 2 копии игры.
- игра "с коробки" не поддерживает FullHD, решается быстро с помощью гайдов в руководстве стима. 

В итоге могу сказать что достаточно необычная РТС, качественных аналогов которой тяжело найти. Очень жаль что в свое время Evil Genius была не сильно популярной. Надеюсь Evil Genius 2, которую сейчас разрабатывает Rebellion, будет достойным продолжением оригинала.

40373253.review: Replayability value is 10/10. Basebuilding and management is the most fun part!. I've played this game countless times over, it's my favourite childhood game aside from Half-Life. I'd pay full price for this gem, if it's on sale you should buy it right away!

40370118.review: Evil Genius is an awesome Dungeon Keeper-esque game with a fun spy twist and enjoyable gameplay. While the brilliant theming is probably the best part of the game, the mechanics of running an evil lair and controlling minions is enjoyable. The worldwide missions leading to world domination are fun, too, although the graphics are dated. Recommended if you like construction and management games with a bit of a unique bent.

Save often. The game still has some random crashes that occur which can set you back to forever ago.

40093900.review:
This game is both crap, and great, at the same time.

This game has a great concept (if you're into old, cartoony 80s Bond movies).
However, the numerous bugs and design flaws drag it down.

For starters, the game that Steam is selling in their store, is not the LATEST latest update.
Here's the long explanation for why:
There are four versions of this game: 1.0, European 1.01, United States 1.01, and 1.1.
Steam offers the latest EUROPEAN patch, which is inferior to the US 1.01 patch, which is in turn required to properly install the 1.1 fan patch (although it can technically be done). Since actually displaying the version number, began in the US 1.01 patch, this took quite some time to figure out.
...and if you're looking to download the 1.1 fan patch, then good luck. There USED to be a place for various mods, called Evil Planet, but it has shut down, so try your luck at Reddit, while THOSE links last.
There are also talks about versions 1.02 and 1.03, but they're apparently Italian language packs and really horribly edited UI textures.

For design flaws, I bet you want to save your game, apart from the autosave.
Well, it turns out that, while you can access the Load menu simply by pressing Escape, the SAVE menu is hidden away under the shortcut Ctrl+L (or F5 for a quick save). ...but later on the Save menu magically turned up for me, under the Load menu, so I'm still scratching my head about that one, considering I'm not the only one having trouble finding it.

You also have a minion limit cap that's ridiculously small, minions that refuse to deploy for missions, minions getting stuck in cages, agents firing at various furniture they don't like, et cetera. It's a mess.

The pace is also DREADFULLY slow, even with the soothing music playing nonstop. It's a constant wait for your minions to eat, train, sleep, fetch, and so on.

Also, the game explains at the start, that there are two bars: Red is heat, which is bad, while green is notoriety, which is good. ...only that's bad as well. If you do evil deeds on the world map, that doesn't involve looting loot, then you'll start unlocking SUPER agents, which will only make the game harder. ...so you get nothing from doing evil deeds in this game.

...but it's the progress stopping bugs, that really kills this game. All the characters in this game, can get randomly stuck in their AI programming. It happens randomly, seemingly mostly at the hotel (so avoid building that), and if any one of them get stuck, out of the hundreds on the map, then you will have a stuck transport. ...and if you get two stuck transports, then you can't deploy for missions anymore.
...and so you have to find which one is stuck (which is a "Where Is Waldo?" game of its own) then open up your save game file in a text editor, and try to figure out the coding, so that you can safely delete the bugged parts, without it crashing the game.

...and if your save isn't completely bug free at the halfway point through the game, at a certain key point, then your game will crash, and if you can't debug this game's code then, then you have to begin a new game, and just hope and pray that the game won't bug out THIS time.
(Luckily I was handed a bugfree save from another player at the forums.)

Does this sound fun to you? :(

In short, this otherwise lovely game, needed A LOT more polish and support.

Still, I hear there is an Evil Genius 2 game in the works, and I'm really looking forward to it.
...but it better be more bugtested than this game.
Maybe you should hold on to your money until either Evil Genius 2 is released, OR they release a proper bug patch.

39960062.review: Evil Genius, um jogo de estrategica e poder para poder desfrutar. Uma optima companhia para quem ama construir e divertir-se.

39912596.review: Ein herrliches Spiel, was dich öfters mal zum schmunzeln bringen wird. Zu empfehlen sind wenige Mods welche auf Nexus verfügbar sind, wie auch der "offizielle" Patch für das Spiel. Ausserdem habe ich um Platz zu sparen und bisschen schön einzurichten, die Spinde bisschen manipuliert ;-) Eine nette funktion verbindet eine geniale Mod welche auch auf Nexus verfügbar ist, das Ctrl.M und Ctrl.N, Daumen hoch dafür^^ Was aber zu bemängeln ist, ist das es bisher nichts gibt wie Automark für die Kameras... Ein tolles Spiel, klare KAUFEMPFEHLUNG - MEGA GEHEIMTIPP

39853985.review: Dieses Spiel ist verdammt alt, dafür aber schön anzusehen und mit Charme. Es ist ein recht einzigartiges Spiel ohne wirkliche Vergleiche. Man startet mit einer Handvoll Arbeitern und einem Handlanger um sich langsam die Welt untertan zu machen und fängt natürlich auf "James Bond Bösewichteart" auf einer kleinen, unbewohnten Insel irgendwo im nirgendwo. Langsam baut man sich in den Berg und errichtet Fallen und Räume, bildet neue Männer aus und erledigt kleine Missionen auf der Weltkarte, welche zunehmend schwerer werden. Natürlich gibt es Gesetzeshüter und Helden! Besonders die Helden sind interessant da man diese nicht einfach töten kann sondern beim "Verhör" experementieren muss.
